dlgLine.text: We're meeting today to discuss the outside threat that has presented itself.

This morning, Marshall Streeter, the leader of the Coyotes gang came to our front gate. From what I have gathered about them, they're one of the most notorious motorcycle gangs in Texas and their numbers and firepower are superior to ours.
They have demanded we hand over Regina to them and they will leave us alone.
That's bullshit!
Please... you'll have your turn to speak.
They are demanding a large amount of supplies. If we cooperate, they promise to leave us alone.
Everyone here will be affected by the outcome - whether it's the loss of supplies or taking a hostile action against the Coyotes. Any suggestions?

Listen - I've been a cop in this state for a good, long time and as far back as I remember, the Coyotes have always been the kind of gang that even the cops stayed the hell away from. They don't give a shit about anyone and they've been running the kind of firepower that will chew us the hell up...
Want my advice - give them what they want and HOPE someone else kills them before they can come back.
<To you> But... if you decide to fight them and you've got a plan that'll put 'em in the ground for good, I'll back ya.
You go to war with them, well, we might as well just shoot ourselves in the head and get it over with.
I've seen this behavior before. The head of the Coyotes - he's nothing but a warlord. Give him what he wants and he'll keep shaking you down until you refuse - then he'll kill us.
No... We need to bring the fight to them. I'm not saying we're not going to lose anyone, but I'm willing to put my own life on the line if that's what it takes.
<To you> However, if you've got another plan, I'm willing to throw my support behind it.
They're used to cops and cartels? Well, I'll show them how a motherfucking United States Ranger does things.
Think I might have flown something in for these guys once...
Anyhow - let's see... I'd prefer not to be killed. On the other hand, I don't really like being threatened...
As long as someone else is doing the fighting, I'm going to vote you take our best crew, outfit them with as many explosives as we can, and we hit them hard.
<To you> But you're the one paying the bills, so I'll go along with whatever you decide. For now.
Personally, I'd send the most expendable people you have. As long as their leader is killed, it doesn't matter if we lose two or three of our 'volunteers.' It won't be our problem anymore.

You want to know what you're in for? Well, I'll tell you. I used to run the Coyotes with my old man, NZ. We were trying to lay low, loot what we needed, and keep our own alive. But Marshall... that bastard had other plans.

He killed NZ - got right up in his face and stabbed him in the gut. I had no choice but to run here - yeah, we knew about you, and that should make you fucking terrified. Marshall Streeter... this world is his fucking playground now.

He's taking anything he wants. We called in the backup - the other charters, affiliates, friends - we did it to protect our own. The Coyotes? It's a small army now. And they're all too afraid of Marshall to challenge him. But he gets taken out - that organization scatters.

There's no reasoning with Marshall. You give me to him, yeah, he'll kill me... eventually. Then he'll come back. And the second you stop giving him what he wants, he's going to knife-fuck the lot of you.
But I know where he is and I know how to stop him. Oh, yeah - your damn right you need me.
So let's load some fucking guns and go give that sick son of a bitch a new dick hole!

If I may... I know that many here favor violence, but I've worked with prisoners - I know that there's good and reason in them, and I think that with a little discussion, we can come to an understanding that could even lead to cooperation between our two groups.
So, I vote we open up negotiations with these Coyotes. Let's see where that leads.
<To you> But, if you feel strongly, that it's not the prudent course of action, I will defer to your experience and make sure everyone knows you have my support.
How many here could have been killed if we hadn't talked to them first?
Give them what they want! They're killers! I'm prepared to live with the consequences of giving into their demands. Emphasis on live - because we won't have given them a reason to kill us!
<To you> However, since you've proven yourself in the past... I'm willing to stand behind you in whatever you decide.
We've already beaten the odds getting this far - why chance it now?
<To you> Seems like we need to make a decision for our group. How are we going to respond to the Coyotes?

dlgAnsw.text: We're going to give Regina to the Coyotes.
We're going to give the supplies to the Coyotes.
I'm going to try and negotiate another solution with them.
We're going to find them and kill Marshall Streeter.

dlgLine.text: The proposal is to hand custody of Regina over to Marshall Streeter to avoid hostilities with the Coyotes. Is this your final decision?
Dammit! I can help you! You want Streeter dead? I know more about the Coyotes than anyone here!

dlgAnsw.text: On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: The proposal is to hand over supplies demanded by Marshall Streeter to avoid hostilities with the Coyotes. Is that your final decision?

dlgAnsw.text: On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: The proposal is to try and negotiate a truce with the Coyotes rather than give into their demands. Is this your final decision?

dlgAnsw.text: On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: The proposal is to ignore the demands of the Coyotes and try to kill Marshall Streeter in the hopes that the Coyotes will fall apart. Is this your final decision?

dlgAnsw.text: On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: The decision is... I'm sorry, Regina. But for the good of the shelter - you will be placed under lock and key and handed back over to your people.
You sons of bitches! You're all signing my goddamn death certificate!
Good - she's the whole reason they came here in the first place! We're better off this way.
Good - she's the whole reason they came here in the first place! We're better off this way.
I don't think this is the right thing to do... But if that's what how you want to play it, I'll back you up.
This is a mistake... It's just going to encourage them.
Really? Okay... Not what I would do, but you're the boss.
Really? Seems like a one-way ticket to Fuckedsylvania to me.
Fuck you all - I hope Marshall strings you all up for the corpses!
Fuck you all - I hope Marshall strings you all up for the corpses!
I would rather we talked to them... but I have faith that you could make this work too.
I would rather we talked to them... I'm not sure how this assists anyone here.
I'm relieved to hear you say that. Things will be a lot less tense around here once we don't have to worry about them anymore.
I'm relieved to hear you say that. Things will be a lot less tense around here once we don't have to worry about them anymore.
The decision is to give a portion of our supplies to the Coyotes. We'll have to make sure we have enough to pay them off when they come back.
Good - we do not want a goddamn war with those animals! We're better off this way.
Good - we do not want a goddamn war with those animals! We're better off this way.
The decision is to not give into the demands of the Coyotes and to try and convince them to cooperate with us or form some kind of alliance.
I... jeez. If you really think you can do it, I'll support you... I guess if the dead can come back to life, who knows?
That's goddamn asinine.
I don't think that's going to accomplish anything... but if you really think so, we can try it.
It's not going to work. You're taking a ridiculous risk here.
Really? Okay... Not what I would do, but you're the boss.
Really? Wow... That can't end well.
Fucking hippy. Sure... Whatever.
Are you fucking high? Why don't you just ask fucking Santa Claus to save us while you're at it.
I have faith that this will work. You're doing the right thing.
I have faith that this will work. You're doing the right thing.
I don't know about this... but you've kept this place together so far, so let's give it a shot.
What? You want to talk to those animals?! I'm all for diplomacy, but I don't think that's going to work.
The decision is to effectively go to war with the Coyotes and try and stop them by killing their leader or forcing them to cease aggression toward us.
This seems risky... but if we're doing this, I got your back.
Maybe if we had the Sheriff and half the DEA, I'd agree - but this is going to get someone here killed!
This is not an easy decision, I know. But it's a brave one and a good call.
This is not an easy decision, I know. But it's a brave one and a good call.
Good. If we do this smart, they won't be a problem by the end of the week.
Good. If we do this smart, they won't be a problem by the end of the week.
I'm already starting to like this place. Can't wait to show Marshall his own balls.
I'm already starting to like this place. Can't wait to show Marshall his own balls.
I don't think violence is the answer... but I have faith you're making the right decision.
I don't think violence is the answer... Does this really serve the greater good here?
I don't know about this... but you've kept this place together so far, so let's give it a shot.
You're going to fight them? That's reckless and it's obvious you don't care one bit about the safety of these people!
That concludes our meeting... We should adjourn and focus on the task in front of us.
